page.title: 07THE CHURCH AT CHURCH FENTON
page.content: The church is an important part of the village.Sunday morning and evening services are held weekly and a family service monthly. The congregation is mainly female and is growing. Most people, especially children attend in the morning.The Sunday school is being revived. A garden party and a Christmas fair are held annually to raise funds. A monthly supper club, weekly fellowship group for Bible reading and a weekly Pathfinders meet. The vicar lives next to the church and his day depends on people's needs.He takes school assemblies, visits the sick, comforts people and gives advice as well as looking after Church business, holding services and confirmation classes. He also looks after 2 other churches at Kirby Wharfe and Ulleskelf and is chaplain to the RAF base.
